uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.model.data.filter

Class JoinerFilter<T extends DataObject,BDO extends DataObject>

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.model.data.filter.JoinerFilter<T,BDO>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - remote table type
    BDO - target table type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    BaseFilter<BDO>, BaseSQLFilter<BDO>, JoinFilter<BDO>, PatternFilter<BDO>, SQLFilter<BDO>, Targetted<BDO>

    public final class JoinerFilter<T extends DataObject,BDO extends DataObject>
extends java.lang.Object
implements SQLFilter<BDO>, JoinFilter<BDO>
    Filter to join two tables. This performs a left join so records without references are available for selection but it also adds the joining clause to the WHERE condition which would normally suppress these. This is to allow OR combinations of filters to work. The records without references are available to OR branches that do not contain this filter. We still have a problem with reversed references (remote table points to source) if different remote peers match different branches of an OR then the target will be matched multiple times so we should consider using a BackJoinFilter instead for these if we don't actually need the joined fields in the result.
    Author:
    spb
